headline.print_headline: Serena Blows Away King on Gusty Day at U.S. Open
headline.main: Serena Blows Away King on Gusty Day at U.S. Open

docs.snippet: World number one Serena Williams blew past Vania King 6-1 6-0  and into the third round of the U.S. Open on a windswept day at Flushing Meadows on Thursday, then pulled a little double duty joining big sister Venus for a doubles win....
docs.lead_paragraph: World number one Serena Williams blew past Vania King 6-1 6-0  and into the third round of the U.S. Open on a windswept day at Flushing Meadows on Thursday, then pulled a little double duty joining big sister Venus for a doubles win.

headline.print_headline: Matt Stroud Named AP Reporter in Morgantown, W.Va.
headline.main: Matt Stroud Named AP Reporter in Morgantown, W.Va.

docs.snippet: Matt Stroud, a reporter covering criminal justice for technology website The Verge, is joining The Associated Press as a correspondent based in Morgantown, home of West Virginia University....
docs.lead_paragraph: Matt Stroud, a reporter covering criminal justice for technology website The Verge, is joining The Associated Press as a correspondent based in Morgantown, home of West Virginia University.

headline.print_headline: Leeds Sack Manager Hockaday After Six Games
headline.main: Leeds Sack Manager Hockaday After Six Games

docs.snippet: Leeds United have sacked manager David Hockaday after only six games in charge, the Championship (second tier) club announced on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Leeds United have sacked manager David Hockaday after only six games in charge, the Championship (second tier) club announced on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: Exclusive: U.S. May Use Secrets Act to Stop Suit Against Iran Sanctions Group
headline.main: Exclusive: U.S. May Use Secrets Act to Stop Suit Against Iran Sanctions Group

docs.snippet: The U.S. government is considering using a powerful national security law to halt a private lawsuit against a non-profit group, United Against A Nuclear Iran, according to a source familiar with the case....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. government is considering using a powerful national security law to halt a private lawsuit against a non-profit group, United Against A Nuclear Iran, according to a source familiar with the case.

headline.print_headline: Gene Studies of Ebola in Sierra Leone Show Virus Is Mutating Fast
headline.main: Gene Studies of Ebola in Sierra Leone Show Virus Is Mutating Fast

docs.snippet: Genetic studies of some of the earliest Ebola cases in Sierra Leone reveal more than 300 genetic changes in the virus as it leapt from person to person, changes that could blunt the effectiveness of diagnostic tests and experimental treatments now...
docs.lead_paragraph: Genetic studies of some of the earliest Ebola cases in Sierra Leone reveal more than 300 genetic changes in the virus as it leapt from person to person, changes that could blunt the effectiveness of diagnostic tests and experimental treatments now in development, researchers said on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: ECB's Coeure Says Action Needed for Euro Zone Recovery
headline.main: ECB's Coeure Says Action Needed for Euro Zone Recovery

docs.snippet: Economic recovery in Europe requires action both on the demand and supply sides and persistence with structural reforms, European Central Bank Executive Board member Benoit Coeure said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Economic recovery in Europe requires action both on the demand and supply sides and persistence with structural reforms, European Central Bank Executive Board member Benoit Coeure said on Thursday.

headline.main: Accounting for the Expanding Carbon Shadow From Coal-Burning Plants

docs.snippet: A pitch for considering a lifetime’s worth of carbon dioxide emissions when examining power plants in the context of climate change....

headline.print_headline: Molinari, Wiesberger Share Lead at Italian Open
headline.main: Molinari, Wiesberger Share Lead at Italian Open

docs.snippet: Home favorite Francesco Molinari and Austria's Bernd Wiesberger both shot 66 to share the first round lead at the Italian Open on Thursday, while Stephen Gallacher's bid to earn a late spot on Europe's Ryder Cup team ran into trouble....
docs.lead_paragraph: Home favorite Francesco Molinari and Austria's Bernd Wiesberger both shot 66 to share the first round lead at the Italian Open on Thursday, while Stephen Gallacher's bid to earn a late spot on Europe's Ryder Cup team ran into trouble.

headline.print_headline: Manziel Appears as Aerobics Instructor in TV Ad
headline.main: Manziel Appears as Aerobics Instructor in TV Ad

docs.snippet: Wearing spandex leggings, a headband and working out a class of exercising women as if he were Richard Simmons. No, we've never seen Johnny Football like this....
